story.text: Crosscut is a stylus & tablet tool for drawing dynamic models of your thoughts. It aspires to be a thing to think through. In Crosscut you sketch, cobble, tinker, and play toward a deeper understanding. Begin by using the drawing tools to sketch something you’re thinking about, as you would with pen & paper. Then, add dynamic behaviors with a programming system that lives right inside your sketches. Each dynamic sketch is a reusable part that you can nest inside other sketches, enabling you to build elaborate models from simple pieces. Ink & Switch. Crosscut: Drawing Dynamic Models [https://www.inkandswitch.com/crosscut/ article]

Ink & Switch have built something close to where I thought I was heading when my attention moved from turtle graphics to federated wiki. [https://dobbse.net/thinair/2012/03/programming-by-touch.html blog]

item.text: Ink & Switch have built something close to where I thought I was heading when my attention moved from turtle graphic to federated wiki.

https://dobbse.net/turtle/wander/
HEIGHT 500
A turtle graphics implementation built with a view to creating a programming environment kids could use on an ipod touch without having to type with their thumbs. [https://dobbse.net/turtle/wander/ app]

Ink & Switch have built something close to where I thought I was heading when my attention moved from turtle graphic to federated wiki. [https://dobbse.net/thinair/2012/03/programming-by-touch.html blog]
